meanings.definition: A type of bit used in horse riding.
meanings.sent1: The horse's snaffles helped the rider control its movements.
meanings.sent2: She adjusted the snaffles on the horse's bridle before the race.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous pony tried to eat the snaffles off the bridle.
meanings.sent4: The shiny snaffles on the bridle gleamed in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The snaffles jingled softly as the horse trotted along.

meanings.definition: To take hold of something quickly and eagerly.
meanings.sent1: He snaffles the last cookie from the jar before anyone else can.
meanings.sent2: She always snaffles the best seat in the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The cat snaffles the toy mouse and runs off with it.
meanings.sent4: The child snaffles the candy and grins mischievously.
meanings.sent5: The squirrel snaffles the nut and scurries up the tree.

meanings.sent1: She snaffles a great deal on Black Friday sales every year.
meanings.sent2: The detective snaffles the criminal before he can escape.
meanings.sent3: He snaffles the opportunity to showcase his talent at the event.
meanings.sent4: The team snaffles victory in the final moments of the game.
meanings.sent5: The student snaffles the top prize in the science fair.
